content.description: Start at the tree on the block.   OPitch 1: Climb the left facing corner above for 15 feet to an overhang, then traverse left to another left facing corner, which is followed up to a belay ledge.   Pitch 2: Climb up a conspicuous flake, then the overhang and a slab above to the top.

Pitch 1: Climb a short, left facing corner to a small ceiling 12 feet up. Cleat this, then continue up another 40 feet, shifting slighlty left to pass around the crumbly looking overhang above. Step right to a belay ledge below the conspicuous chimney.

 Pitch 2: Traverse left, then undercling (slightly smoothed out now) and pull directly over the center of the ceiling (alternate belay here), traverse right to the center of it where you can reach over the lip for holds. Pull up to a stance, then step left and climb the next overhang at a weakness to the the top.
content.protection: Small to mid cams and a set of stoppers (basic gap rack).
content.location: 30 feet right of Die Hard at the base of the joining trees.

content.description:
Pitch 1: Same first pitch as "Chimney Sweep", except instead of passing left around the overhang climb at its center.

 Pitch 2: Climb the steep wall right of the chimney.
content.protection: Small to mid cams and a set of stoppers (basic gap rack).

content.description: Pitch 1 (5.6)   Climb up corner passing an old pin before entering wide groove. Exit groove on left and belay at sawed off tree stump. A gear anchor is needed(#3 BD useful)   Pitch 2 (5.8)   Continue up left facing corner until stopped by roof (crux). Use crack at right of roof to awkwardly pull over into vegetated corner. Original finish (continued up left facing corner) is now full of vegetation and is not passable.    Proposed new finish move 5 feet to the left of corner and climb slabby face. Finish left of jutting roof at top. To descend walk right to 4th Class Ramp. (As of July '14 no slings) Down-climbable
content.protection: Typical water gap rack.   Crux can be protected by a #4 BD   Be careful in placements as some rock is loose.
content.location: Left facing corner to the right Die Hard.

content.description: Climb the corner right of 'Die Hard' for about 30 to 35 feet to an overhang. Move right to another corner. Go up through the chimney, then angle left across a slab to the first left facing corner. Go up the corner, climbing a small overhang at a crack and continue up past the right end of a slab to the top.

Pitch 1:Climb the bulging slab to the horizontals cracks.   Pitch 2:Continue straight up and then somewhat right to 'Easter Egg Hunt's" belay ledge in the corner below the overhang.   Pitch 3: Step left and follow a steep set of corners above the left edge of the tree on the block under 'Thunderbear". Step right and move up a thin face to a horizontal crack. Step up the shallow, right facing corner and reach out right to the horizontal crack. Work straight up until you can pass the ceiling on it's right.

Start at a freindly looking low-angle face about 70' uphill of toproper's buttress.  There will be 3 medium size trees to your left, and 2 large oak trees about 20' to your right.Pitch 1: (5.3PG?) Climb easily up, trending left till you reach a crumbly looking overhang with layers of shale in it.  Head left under the overhang and around a small corner to a ledge in a notch with a slung chockstone.  Belay on the chockstone.  Rappel thru the trees or continue up.Pitch 2.  (5.5PG) Stem up the notch or go around it on the left (easier).  Head up into the chimney where an awkward overhanging exit awaits.  This will feel hard if you don't do it right.  Exit to the top and belay on some medium size trees.Descent - Hike back about 50' thru some thorny brush to gain the overcliff trail.  Follow it uphill to any of the rappels above.  When the trail comes near the cliff edge before steepening, you'll see the obvious face of The Black Wall.  There is a rappel tree just below the lip here, but I recommend continuing up another 100 feet to a 2 rope rape from the bolts on The Rib.
content.protection: Small to mid cams and a set of stoppers (basic gap rack).

content.description: Always shaded, this bulging face is hard to miss, you have to walk around it to continue up the trail.
